article: I work with Volunteers for Wildlife, a rescue and education organization at Bailey Arboretum in Locust Valley. Trying to help _ , displaced or sick creatures can be heartbreaking; _ is never certain. However, when it works, it is _ beautiful. I got a rescue call from a woman in Muttontown. She had found a young owlon the ground. When I arrived, I saw a 2-to-3-week-old owl. It had already been placed in a carrier for _ . I _ the chickand it seemed tine. If I could _ the nest, I might have been able to put it _ , but no luck. My next work was to construct a nest and _ it in a tree. The homeowner was very _ . A wire basket was found. I put some pine _ into the basket to make this nest safe and comfortable. I placed the chick in the nest, and it quickly _ down. Now all that was needed were the _ but they were absent. I gave the homeowner a recording of the _ screams of owl chicks. These _ the presence of chicks to adults; they might also encourage our chick to start calling _ I gave the owner as much information as possible and headed home to see what news the night might bring. A _ night to be sure, but sometimes the spirits of nature _ on us all! The homeowner called to say that the parents had _ to the recordings. I drove over and saw the chick in the nest looking healthy and active. And it was _ by the greatest sight of all LUNCH! The parents had done their _ and would probably continue to do so.
